00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  The comma operator
00004 #
00005 package Parser::BOP::comma;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Start forming a list, and set the list type if
00011 #    the left and right operands are the same type.
00012 #  If the left or right operands are already lists,
00013 #    update the number of items in the new list.
00014 #
00015 sub _check {
00016   my $self = shift;
00017   my ($ltype,$rtype) = ($self->{lop}->typeRef,$self->{rop}->typeRef);
00018   my $type = Value::Type('Comma',2,$Value::Type{unknown});
00019   if ($ltype->{name} eq 'Comma') {
00020     $type->{length} += $self->{lop}->length - 1;
00021     $ltype = $self->{lop}->entryType;
00022   }
00023   if ($rtype->{name} eq 'Comma') {
00024     $type->{length} += $self->{rop}->length - 1;
00025     $rtype = $self->{rop}->entryType;
00026   }
00027   $type->{entryType} = $ltype if (Parser::Item::typeMatch($ltype,$rtype));
00028   $self->{type} = $type;
00029 }
00030 
00031 #
00032 #  evaluate by forming a list
00033 #
00034 sub _eval {($_[1],$_[2])}
00035 
00036 #
00037 #  If the operator is listed as a comma, make a list
00038 #    out of the lists that are the left and right operands.
00039 #  Otherwise return the item itself
00040 #
00041 sub makeList {
00042   my $self = shift;
00043   return $self unless ($self->{def}{isComma});
00044   return ($self->{lop}->makeList,$self->{rop}->makeList);
00045 }
